topic.title: What's wrong with socialism?
topic.body:

1584744394_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
The issue is that the way the economy functions in America is totaly at odds with something like covid-19.
Another issue is that the USD is basically the life tree of the global economy.

1584256859_1G9k2b4cSRzZSfLQuzxmpJB3LT3Gf.body: Why is Zeronet filled to the brim with brain dead boomers?

The type of person I want to see is some one who doesn't call covid-19 a hoax. Also, there's an alarming rate of young people dying from it too.

1585882218_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
I used to believe in conspiracies.
Then I became a man and picked up Das Kapital.

Conspiracy theories serve no other purpose than to distract the population from the real issues of global capitalism.
They are just another method the ruling class implores in their arsenal of psychological warfare against the working class.

1586981807_145UdHkipHkyVRvbjGSB8CLGt9Jwz.body: I'm doing ok. Ready to get the fuck out of this god damn house that's for sure.

1587114042_1ErPX9yuZjokdcxUGavdRYRhwynA4.body: I don't understand why you guys hate socialism so much, lol.

1587305852_1e6paNoDoqwCZGNa4o4uX43GrawvJ.body:
> [ranshit](#comment_136_17XPGJDqy3F7zfV3sa4aMJF2Mhpati6N12): While I would support a socialist economy, one just doesn't seem possible due to human laziness to ensure the success of socialism or it fails due to the greed of humanity in that some group will attempt to funnel resources solely to themselves. (which will deprive resources away from the socialist community). So while socialism may work in theory, we as a species aren't mature enough for such economic concepts. [...]

I actually don't, totally, disagree with that sentiment. Though, I disagree as to the causes of it. I think that the reason socialistic economic systems fail with in the framework of a global capitalist hegemony is because they falter under pressure exerted on them by the influences of capital itself. Not because of some "human nature" People have been programed to behave the way they do.

> [styromaniac](#comment_2060_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Democratic socialism seems fine. I'm with Bernie's ideals. I don't confuse it with communism.

I think communism is really the onyl logical conclusion where the human species survives at this point.

> [aassddff](#comment_97_1A8k2FFyono2dUQWKaRzsRvbXguVuXQHYS): Don't feel like writing much about it right now, but assuming you mean Marxism variants the main thing is Materialism.Same issue I have with Italian Fascism focus on the state or National Socialism's obsession for races.Materialistic ideals always converge to degeneration and spiritual disorder.Just see how people in China seem to be all traumatized. See shit happening, but feel powerless to do anything. Makes sense, years ago they were being encouraged by the government to physically fight against their own family and burn down the temples they used to go to.All of the inherent failures in Marxist-variant systems are consequences of the spiritual, ethical and moral degeneracy it causes.

What is "spiritual disorder" There is *only* the material world, lad. China is not the only socialistic model than can or should be persuide. The issue with china and other more authoritarian variants of socialism is the fact that they lack any real democracy. By "Real" democracy I mean a democracy run directly by the people both economically and politically.

1592264885_191jbK3GNmVritcMymKkFuxyYFXxq.body: The changes will never come, precisely because peaceful protests do nothing. You must work from outside the system in order to achieve any meaningful change. Our political system in America does not care about the will of the masses and never has. It was not constructed to act that way. The American political system is designed to facilitate and maintain the existence of property and plutocratic domination. The only thing that can help us at this point is a full blown revolution against the American government.

fake news. Raz is not the leader of the commune. There are no leaders.

> [bigbadbob](#comment_1089_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdoUTXAj): Working for themselves would be better... But what are they doing?   I saw a picture of a garden.  It didn't look all that good.  Would hope they would at least have "some" skills to justify their declaration of sovereignty. I have no idea what is going on over there.  The only info I have access to MSM propaganda.  Maybe the can't afford police anymore or are too cheap,  or maybe it's just election year.   Glad I don't live there.  But here is far from perfect too.

Lol, Gardens don't just spring up over night. I mean, I am not saying it's perfect it's deff got some problems but we've not seen something like this in America for at least 60 years.

yeah, blm "leadership" is literally a bunch of feds.

It takes 1-2 years before you can use human shit to grow food. They should at least get an emergency supply set up until they have a reliable way of growing food or create a trade network. [...]
